description: When checking if an instance is in the same AZ as a volume nova uses the instances availability_zone attribute. This isn't the correct way to get an instances AZ, it should use the value gotten through querying the aggregate the instance is on
title: cinder cross_az_attach uses instance AZ value

comments.content: When checking if an instance is in the same AZ as a volume nova uses the instances availability_zone attribute. This isn't the correct way to get an instances AZ, it should use the value gotten through querying the aggregate the instance is on
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sorrison

comments.content:
Hmm, it seems wrong to record that in two places.

Also it seems a bit expensive to always check the aggregate.

I am torn.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
I guess the real bug, is if you change the aggregate, the instance doesn't reflect that change?

Or is the instance not updated correctly in all cases?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
instance['availability_zone'] is the requested availability zone not the actual availability_zone of the instance.

To find the instances availability zone you need to call the get_instance_availability_zone method in nova.availability_zones.

I have a patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58646/

There is one issue with the patch and that is boot from volume. Because you don't know the availability_zone when you're booting an instance the cross_az check fails.

commit 18a1486293b15c5713ac1352b9b9b30fdf2b7413
Author: Sam Morrison <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Nov 27 10:19:50 2013 +1100

    Fix instance cross AZ check when attaching volumes
    
    For CONF.cinder_cross_az_attach=False, we currently only check the desired AZ
    during scheduling but don't actually check the final AZ of the node.
    
    When attaching volumes to running instances we need to check the actual
    AZ on the instance and not the desired AZ at boot time. The desired AZ
    attribute is optional at boot and may not be set or the desired AZ
    could be different from the final AZ.
    When we are booting with a volume however we don't know the final AZ so we
    check on the desired AZ.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1255347
    Change-Id: Ied912c171100a450754d315027bf5c407ac067bb
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
